kpa.model

Class KPuzzle

  • java.lang.Object
    • kpa.model.KPuzzle

  • public class KPuzzle
extends java.lang.Object
    State of a Kakuro puzzle, without auxiliary solver-related information: the collection of entries, and the states of the cells in the grid (mutable). Acts as a fa√ßade for the underlying classes. A Kakuro puzzle has
    • a name;
    • minimum and maximum value for cell states, the minimum is at least one, and the maximum is at least the minimum;
    • a mode of operation;
    • a grid of cells.

    • Nested Class Summary

      The possible modes of a puzzle.

        public void setMinNumber(int minNumber)
        Sets the smallest number allowed in a cell. Only allowed in edit mode.
        Parameters:
        minNumber - the new minimum number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not in edit mode
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if minNumber < 1
        Precondition:
        puzzle is in edit mode and minNumber >= 1

        public void setMaxNumber(int maxNumber)
        Sets the largest number allowed in a cell. Only allowed in edit mode.
        Parameters:
        maxNumber - the new maximum number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not in edit mode
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxNumber < getMinNumber()
        Precondition:
        puzzle is in edit mode and maxNumber >= getMinNumber()

        Parameters:
        n - the number to check
        Returns:
        whether n is valid

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks whether the current state of the puzzle is valid. That is, whether it adheres to the rules:
        • Each non-blocked cell is either empty or contains a valid number (see isValidNumber(int))
        • For each (horizontal or vertical) entry, the numbers appearing in it are all distinct
        • For each (horizontal or vertical) entry with at least one empty cell, the sum of the numbers it contains sums to less than the specified total
        • For each (horizontal or vertical) entry without empty cells, the sum of the numbers it contains equals the specified total
        Returns:
        whether the current state of this puzzle is valid

      • getCells

      • getCell

        public KCell getCell(int rowIndex,
                     int columnIndex)
        Gets the cell at given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the row coordinate to get from
        columnIndex - the column coordinate to get from
        Returns:
        cell at rowIndex, columnIndex
        Precondition:
        0 <= rowIndex < getRows() && 0 <= columnIndex < getColumns()
        Postcondition:
        \result = cells[rowIndex, columnIndex]

        public int getStateCount(int state)
        Gets number of cells with a given state.
        Parameters:
        state - the given state
        Returns:
        number of cells with state state
        Postcondition:
        \result == (\num_of Cell cell : getCells(); cell.getState() == state)
